result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: It is the court's intention the conditions of probation be the same as the conditions of extended supervision if the defendant is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain verifiable employment of at least 30 hours per week. If not employed 30 hours per week, be enrolled in an educational program.
Obtain HSED.
No contact with the co-defendant Norman Boose.

Participate in a cognitive thinking program.
Attend parenting class.
Participate in vocational programming.

Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.
AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered 9 MONTHS of condition time in the House of Correction. Defendant may have release to the Day Reporting Center, and may participate in educational and vocational programming at the House of Correction.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald L Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING (34 pages) commencing OCTOBER 8, 2015 received and filed.
for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges; signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Wagner  Br 38, for review. os
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. File stamp is incorrect on the first page of the PSI. PSI was received and filed on 10/02/15.  Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Reginald L Harris in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Reginald L Harris in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

Court took a brief break during the plea colloquy to allow time for the defendant to speak to his attorney. Case back on the record. Appearances remain the same.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Poulson for Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Reginald L Harris not in court, in custody.  Kim Schoepp for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 20.   All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be reassigned to Branch 25, Judge Stephanie Rothstein, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 7/23/15.  Bench Warrant filed.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.
Justice Point Discharge Summary received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report (stand supervision) received and filed.
Status update report from Justice Point, received and filed.  Defendant tested positive for THC.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was ordered to report to Justice Point, was drug tested, tested positive, and left Justice Point before caseworkder could bring him to court, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.  The 8/13/15 plea and sentencing date was ordered vacated.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order signed and filed.

Case recalled.  Court ordered that defendant be drug tested by Justice Point, as that condition was not previously ordered. Court ordered that defendant have no controlled substances or alcohol; there is to be random drug testing; no firearms or weapons; no contact with any of the victim Sergey K.; no contact with co-defendant Norman Boose.

Defendant Reginald L Harris in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date indicating that his client's aunt has the discovery and defendant did not read same.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be heard before the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G-55A  of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Harris in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing.  Defense requests time to review recently received discovery materials; motion for adjournment granted by the court.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, filed.

15RM029652  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/13/2015
Defense counsel requsted a plea date.  Court granted defense request ordered case adjourned matter for plea and sentencing before Branch 20 on 6/29/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Reginald L Harris not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.
/for Modification of Bail, received and filed.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Reginald L Harris not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance.  Court ordered case set for another bail hearing as defense counsel needs to provide additional documentation.  File retained in court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Reginald L Harris not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date; needs an offer from the State.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.

Attorney Richard A. Sachs in court, defendant Reginald L Harris not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reginald L Harris in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Defendant Reginald L Harris in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Sergey K; 5145 W Churchill Lane; Co-Defendant: Norman Boose.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Reginald L Harris in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Reginald L Harris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
